From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Late Latin operāre. Doublet of obrar, which was inherited.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [u.pəˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [o.pəˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [o.peˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

operar (first-person singular present opero, first-person singular preterite operí, past participle operat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /e/

  1. to produce, to achieve
  2. to operate (to perform surgery)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of operar (first conjugation)
infinitive operar
gerund operant
past participle masculine feminine
singular operat operada
plural operats operades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present opero operes opera operem opereu operen
imperfect operava operaves operava operàvem operàveu operaven
future operaré operaràs operarà operarem operareu operaran
preterite operí operares operà operàrem operàreu operaren
conditional operaria operaries operaria operaríem operaríeu operarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present operi operis operi operem opereu operin
imperfect operés operessis operés operéssim operéssiu operessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — opera operi operem opereu operin
negative (no) — no operis no operi no operem no opereu no operin

Related terms

[edit]
  • cooperar
  • operació
  • operador
  • operatiu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “operar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “operar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “operar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “operar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Verb

[edit]

operar

  1. to operate

Conjugation

[edit]

participle present perfect
operante operate

Maltese

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ɔ.pɛˈraːr/
  • Rhymes: -aːr

Noun

[edit]

operar m

  1. verbal noun of opera

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Late Latin operārī. Doublet of obrar, which was inherited.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /o.peˈɾa(ʁ)/ [o.peˈɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /o.peˈɾa(ʁ)/ [o.peˈɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /o.peˈɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /o.peˈɾa(ʁ)/ [o.peˈɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /o.peˈɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɔ.pɨˈɾaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɔ.pɨˈɾaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /ɔ.pɨˈɾa.ɾi/

  • Audio (Brazil (Caipira)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: o‧pe‧rar

Verb

[edit]

operar (first-person singular present opero, first-person singular preterite operei, past participle operado)

  1. to operate, function

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of operar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person

Masculine operado operados
Feminine operada operadas

Present opero operas opera operamos operais operam
Imperfect operava operavas operava operávamos operáveis operavam
Preterite operei operaste operou operamos1, operámos2 operastes operaram
Pluperfect operara operaras operara operáramos operáreis operaram
Future operarei operarás operará operaremos operareis operarão
Conditional operaria operarias operaria operaríamos operaríeis operariam
Subjunctive
Present opere operes opere operemos opereis operem
Imperfect operasse operasses operasse operássemos operásseis operassem
Future operar operares operar operarmos operardes operarem
Imperative
Affirmative opera opere operemos operai operem
Negative (não) não operes não opere não operemos não opereis não operem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Further reading

[edit]
  • “operar”, in Dicionário Aulete Digital (in Portuguese), Rio de Janeiro: Lexikon Editora Digital, 2008–2025
  • “operar”, in Dicionário inFormal (in Portuguese), 2006–2025
  • “operar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “operar”, in Dicionário infopédia da Lingua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Porto: Porto Editora, 2003–2025
  • “operar”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “operar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Late Latin operāre. Doublet of obrar, which was inherited.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /opeˈɾaɾ/ [o.peˈɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: o‧pe‧rar

Verb

[edit]

operar (first-person singular present opero, first-person singular preterite operé, past participle operado)

  1. to operate (to perform surgery)
  2. to produce, to achieve
    Synonym: realizar
  3. to operate (to deal in a commodity)
  4. (reflexive) to undergo plastic surgery
    ¿Te has operado de algo?
    Have you undergone some plastic surgery?
    Mi hermana quiere operarse.
    My sister wants to have work done.
    Dicen que esta actriz porno está operada.
    They say that this porn actress has had plastic surgery.

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of operar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive operar
gerund operando
past participle masculine feminine
singular operado operada
plural operados operadas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
